register.name: DEVICE_ID
register.description: Device ID

field.name: DEVICEID
field.description: PARTID

register.name: CFG
register.description: USART Configuration register. Basic USART configuration settings that typically are not changed during operation.

field.name: ENABLE
field.description: USART Enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The USART is disabled and the internal state machine and counters are reset. While Enable = 0, all USART interrupts and DMA transfers are disabled. When Enable is set again, CFG and most other control bits remain unchanged. For instance, when re-enabled, the USART will immediately generate a TxRdy interrupt (if enabled in the INTENSET register) or a DMA transfer request because the transmitter has been reset and is therefore available.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The USART is enabled for operation.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: DATALEN
field.description: Selects the data size for the USART.

enumeratedValue.name: 9_BIT_DATA_LENGTH
enumeratedValue.description: 9 bit data length. The 9th bit is commonly used for addressing in multidrop mode. See the ADDRDET bit in the CTL register.

field.name: PARITYSEL
field.description: Selects what type of parity is used by the USART.

enumeratedValue.name: EVEN_PARITY
enumeratedValue.description: Even parity. Adds a bit to each character such that the number of 1s in a transmitted character is even, and the number of 1s in a received character is expected to be even.

enumeratedValue.name: ODD_PARITY
enumeratedValue.description: Odd parity. Adds a bit to each character such that the number of 1s in a transmitted character is odd, and the number of 1s in a received character is expected to be odd.

field.name: STOPLEN
field.description: Number of stop bits appended to transmitted data. Only a single stop bit is required for received data.

enumeratedValue.name: 2_STOP_BITS
enumeratedValue.description: 2 stop bits. This setting should only be used for asynchronous communication.

field.name: MODE32K
field.description: Selects standard or 32 kHz clocking mode.

enumeratedValue.name: 32KHZ
enumeratedValue.description: UART uses the 32 kHz clock from the RTC oscillator as the clock source to the BRG, and uses a special bit clocking scheme.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: CTSEN
field.description: CTS Enable. Determines whether CTS is used for flow control. CTS can be from the input pin, or from the USART's own RTS if loopback mode is enabled. See Section 11.8.4 for more information.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_FLOW_CONTROL
enumeratedValue.description: No flow control. The transmitter does not receive any automatic flow control signal.

enumeratedValue.name: FLOW_CONTROL_ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Flow control enabled. The transmitter uses the CTS input (or RTS output in loopback mode) for flow control purposes.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: SYNCEN
field.description: Selects synchronous or asynchronous operation.

field.name: CLKPOL
field.description: Selects the clock polarity and sampling edge of received data in synchronous mode.

enumeratedValue.name: FALLING_EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Falling edge. Un_RXD is sampled on the falling edge of SCLK.

enumeratedValue.name: RISING_EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Rising edge. Un_RXD is sampled on the rising edge of SCLK.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: SYNCMST
field.description: Synchronous mode Master select.

enumeratedValue.name: SLAVE
enumeratedValue.description: Slave. When synchronous mode is enabled, the USART is a slave.

enumeratedValue.name: MASTER
enumeratedValue.description: Master. When synchronous mode is enabled, the USART is a master.

field.name: LOOP
field.description: Selects data loopback mode.

enumeratedValue.name: LOOPBACK_MODE
enumeratedValue.description: Loopback mode. This provides a mechanism to perform diagnostic loopback testing for USART data. Serial data from the transmitter (Un_TXD) is connected internally to serial input of the receive (Un_RXD). Un_TXD and Un_RTS activity will also appear on external pins if these functions are configured to appear on device pins. The receiver RTS signal is also looped back to CTS and performs flow control if enabled by CTSEN.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: OETA
field.description: Output Enable Turnaround time enable for RS-485 operation.

enumeratedValue.name: DEASSERTED
enumeratedValue.description: Deasserted. If selected by OESEL, the Output Enable signal deasserted at the end of the last stop bit of a transmission.

enumeratedValue.name: ASSERTED
enumeratedValue.description: Asserted. If selected by OESEL, the Output Enable signal remains asserted for 1 character time after then end the last stop bit of a transmission. OE will also remain asserted if another transmit begins before it is deasserted.

field.name: AUTOADDR
field.description: Automatic Address matching enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. When addressing is enabled by ADDRDET, address matching is done by software. This provides the possibility of versatile addressing (e.g. respond to more than one address).

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. When addressing is enabled by ADDRDET, address matching is done by hardware, using the value in the ADDR register as the address to match.

field.name: OESEL
field.description: Output Enable Select.

enumeratedValue.name: FLOW_CONTROL
enumeratedValue.description: Flow control. The RTS signal is used as the standard flow control function.

enumeratedValue.name: OUTPUT_ENABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Output enable. The RTS signal is taken over in order to provide an output enable signal to control an RS-485 transceiver.

field.name: OEPOL
field.description: Output Enable Polarity.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW
enumeratedValue.description: Low. If selected by OESEL, the output enable is active low.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: High. If selected by OESEL, the output enable is active high.

field.name: RXPOL
field.description: Receive data polarity.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_CHANGED
enumeratedValue.description: Not changed. The RX signal is used as it arrives from the pin. This means that the RX rest value is 1, start bit is 0, data is not inverted, and the stop bit is 1.

enumeratedValue.name: INVERTED
enumeratedValue.description: Inverted. The RX signal is inverted before being used by the UART. This means that the RX rest value is 0, start bit is 1, data is inverted, and the stop bit is 0.

field.name: TXPOL
field.description: Transmit data polarity.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_CHANGED
enumeratedValue.description: Not changed. The TX signal is sent out without change. This means that the TX rest value is 1, start bit is 0, data is not inverted, and the stop bit is 1.

enumeratedValue.name: INVERTED
enumeratedValue.description: Inverted. The TX signal is inverted by the UART before being sent out. This means that the TX rest value is 0, start bit is 1, data is inverted, and the stop bit is 0.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: CTL
register.description: USART Control register. USART control settings that are more likely to change during operation.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: TXBRKEN
field.description: Break Enable.

enumeratedValue.name: CONTINUOUS_BREAK_IS
enumeratedValue.description: Continuous break is sent immediately when this bit is set, and remains until this bit is cleared. A break may be sent without danger of corrupting any currently transmitting character if the transmitter is first disabled (TXDIS in CTL is set) and then waiting for the transmitter to be disabled (TXDISINT in STAT = 1) before writing 1 to TXBRKEN.

field.name: ADDRDET
field.description: Enable address detect mode.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The USART presents all incoming data.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The USART receiver ignores incoming data that does not have the most significant bit of the data (typically the 9th bit) = 1. When the data MSB bit = 1, the receiver treats the incoming data normally, generating a received data interrupt. Software can then check the data to see if this is an address that should be handled. If it is, the ADDRDET bit is cleared by software and further incoming data is handled normally.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: TXDIS
field.description: Transmit Disable.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Not disabled. USART transmitter is not disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. USART transmitter is disabled after any character currently being transmitted is complete. This feature can be used to facilitate software flow control.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: CC
field.description: Continuous Clock generation. By default, SCLK is only output while data is being transmitted in synchronous mode.

enumeratedValue.name: CLOCK_ON_CHARACTER
enumeratedValue.description: Clock on character. In synchronous mode, SCLK cycles only when characters are being sent on Un_TXD or to complete a character that is being received.

enumeratedValue.name: CONTINUOUS_CLOCK
enumeratedValue.description: Continuous clock. SCLK runs continuously in synchronous mode, allowing characters to be received on Un_RxD independently from transmission on Un_TXD).

field.name: CLRCCONRX
field.description: Clear Continuous Clock.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_EFFECT
enumeratedValue.description: No effect on the CC bit.

enumeratedValue.name: AUTO_CLEAR
enumeratedValue.description: Auto-clear. The CC bit is automatically cleared when a complete character has been received. This bit is cleared at the same time.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: AUTOBAUD
field.description: Autobaud enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. UART is in normal operating mode.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. UART is in autobaud mode. This bit should only be set when the UART receiver is idle. The first start bit of RX is measured and used the update the BRG register to match the received data rate. AUTOBAUD is cleared once this process is complete, or if there is an AERR. This bit can be cleared by software when set, but only when the UART receiver is idle.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: STAT
register.description: USART Status register. The complete status value can be read here. Writing ones clears some bits in the register. Some bits can be cleared by writing a 1 to them.

field.name: RXRDY
field.description: Receiver Ready flag. When 1, indicates that data is available to be read from the receiver buffer. Cleared after a read of the RXDAT or RXDATSTAT registers.

field.name: RXIDLE
field.description: Receiver Idle. When 0, indicates that the receiver is currently in the process of receiving data. When 1, indicates that the receiver is not currently in the process of receiving data.

field.name: TXRDY
field.description: Transmitter Ready flag. When 1, this bit indicates that data may be written to the transmit buffer. Previous data may still be in the process of being transmitted. Cleared when data is written to TXDAT. Set when the data is moved from the transmit buffer to the transmit shift register.

field.name: TXIDLE
field.description: Transmitter Idle. When 0, indicates that the transmitter is currently in the process of sending data.When 1, indicate that the transmitter is not currently in the process of sending data.

field.name: CTS
field.description: This bit reflects the current state of the CTS signal, regardless of the setting of the CTSEN bit in the CFG register. This will be the value of the CTS input pin unless loopback mode is enabled.

field.name: DELTACTS
field.description: This bit is set when a change in the state is detected for the CTS flag above. This bit is cleared by software.

field.name: TXDISSTAT
field.description: Transmitter Disabled Interrupt flag. When 1, this bit indicates that the USART transmitter is fully idle after being disabled via the TXDIS in the CFG register (TXDIS = 1).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: OVERRUNINT
field.description: Overrun Error interrupt flag. This flag is set when a new character is received while the receiver buffer is still in use. If this occurs, the newly received character in the shift register is lost.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: RXBRK
field.description: Received Break. This bit reflects the current state of the receiver break detection logic. It is set when the Un_RXD pin remains low for 16 bit times. Note that FRAMERRINT will also be set when this condition occurs because the stop bit(s) for the character would be missing. RXBRK is cleared when the Un_RXD pin goes high.

field.name: DELTARXBRK
field.description: This bit is set when a change in the state of receiver break detection occurs. Cleared by software.

field.name: START
field.description: This bit is set when a start is detected on the receiver input. Its purpose is primarily to allow wake-up from Deep-sleep or Power-down mode immediately when a start is detected. Cleared by software.

field.name: FRAMERRINT
field.description: Framing Error interrupt flag. This flag is set when a character is received with a missing stop bit at the expected location. This could be an indication of a baud rate or configuration mismatch with the transmitting source.

field.name: PARITYERRINT
field.description: Parity Error interrupt flag. This flag is set when a parity error is detected in a received character..

field.name: RXNOISEINT
field.description: Received Noise interrupt flag. Three samples of received data are taken in order to determine the value of each received data bit, except in synchronous mode. This acts as a noise filter if one sample disagrees. This flag is set when a received data bit contains one disagreeing sample. This could indicate line noise, a baud rate or character format mismatch, or loss of synchronization during data reception.

field.name: ABERR
field.description: Auto-baud Error. An auto-baud error can occur if the BRG counts to its limit before the end of the start bit that is being measured, essentially an auto-baud time-out.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: INTENSET
register.description: Interrupt Enable read and Set register. Contains an individual interrupt enable bit for each potential USART interrupt. A complete value may be read from this register. Writing a 1 to any implemented bit position causes that bit to be set.

field.name: RXRDYEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when there is a received character available to be read from the RXDAT register.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: TXRDYEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when the TXDAT register is available to take another character to transmit.

field.name: TXIDLEEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when the transmitter becomes idle (TXIDLE = 1).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: DELTACTSEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when there is a change in the state of the CTS input.

field.name: TXDISEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when the transmitter is fully disabled as indicated by the TXDISINT flag in STAT. See description of the TXDISINT bit for details.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: OVERRUNEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when an overrun error occurred.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: DELTARXBRKEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when a change of state has occurred in the detection of a received break condition (break condition asserted or deasserted).

field.name: STARTEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when a received start bit has been detected.

field.name: FRAMERREN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when a framing error has been detected.

field.name: PARITYERREN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when a parity error has been detected.

field.name: RXNOISEEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when noise is detected.

field.name: ABERREN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when an auto-baud error occurs.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: INTENCLR
register.description: Interrupt Enable Clear register. Allows clearing any combination of bits in the INTENSET register. Writing a 1 to any implemented bit position causes the corresponding bit to be cleared.

field.name: RXRDYCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: TXRDYCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: TXIDLECLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: DELTACTSCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: TXDISINTCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: OVERRUNCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: DELTARXBRKCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: STARTCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: FRAMERRCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: PARITYERRCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: RXNOISECLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: ABERRCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: RXDAT
register.description: Receiver Data register. Contains the last character received.

field.name: RXDAT
field.description: The USART Receiver Data register contains the next received character. The number of bits that are relevant depends on the USART configuration settings.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, the value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: RXDATSTAT
register.description: Receiver Data with Status register. Combines the last character received with the current USART receive status. Allows DMA or software to recover incoming data and status together.

field.name: RXDAT
field.description: The USART Receiver Data register contains the next received character. The number of bits that are relevant depends on the USART configuration settings.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, the value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: FRAMERR
field.description: Framing Error status flag. This bit is valid when there is a character to be read in the RXDAT register and reflects the status of that character. This bit will set when the character in RXDAT was received with a missing stop bit at the expected location. This could be an indication of a baud rate or configuration mismatch with the transmitting source.

field.name: PARITYERR
field.description: Parity Error status flag. This bit is valid when there is a character to be read in the RXDAT register and reflects the status of that character. This bit will be set when a parity error is detected in a received character.

field.name: RXNOISE
field.description: Received Noise flag. See description of the RXNOISEINT bit in Table 133.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, the value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: TXDAT
register.description: Transmit Data register. Data to be transmitted is written here.

field.name: TXDAT
field.description: Writing to the USART Transmit Data Register causes the data to be transmitted as soon as the transmit shift register is available and any conditions for transmitting data are met: CTS low (if CTSEN bit = 1), TXDIS bit = 0.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Only zero should be written.

register.name: BRG
register.description: Baud Rate Generator register. 16-bit integer baud rate divisor value.

field.name: BRGVAL
field.description: This value is used to divide the USART input clock to determine the baud rate, based on the input clock from the FRG. 0 = The FRG clock is used directly by the USART function. 1 = The FRG clock is divided by 2 before use by the USART function. 2 = The FRG clock is divided by 3 before use by the USART function. ... 0xFFFF = The FRG clock is divided by 65,536 before use by the USART function.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: INTSTAT
register.description: Interrupt status register. Reflects interrupts that are currently enabled.

field.name: RXRDY
field.description: Receiver Ready flag.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: TXRDY
field.description: Transmitter Ready flag.

field.name: TXIDLE
field.description: Transmitter idle status.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: DELTACTS
field.description: This bit is set when a change in the state of the CTS input is detected.

field.name: TXDISINT
field.description: Transmitter Disabled Interrupt flag.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: OVERRUNINT
field.description: Overrun Error interrupt flag.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: DELTARXBRK
field.description: This bit is set when a change in the state of receiver break detection occurs.

field.name: START
field.description: This bit is set when a start is detected on the receiver input.

field.name: FRAMERRINT
field.description: Framing Error interrupt flag.

field.name: PARITYERRINT
field.description: Parity Error interrupt flag.

field.name: RXNOISEINT
field.description: Received Noise interrupt flag.

field.name: ABERR
field.description: Auto-baud Error flag.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: OSR
register.description: Oversample selection register for asynchronous communication.

field.name: OSRVAL
field.description: Oversample Selection Value. 0 to 3 = not supported 0x4 = 5 peripheral clocks are used to transmit and receive each data bit. 0x5 = 6 peripheral clocks are used to transmit and receive each data bit. ... 0xF= 16 peripheral clocks are used to transmit and receive each data bit.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, the value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: ADDR
register.description: Address register for automatic address matching.

field.name: ADDRESS
field.description: 8-bit address used with automatic address matching. Used when address detection is enabled (ADDRDET in CTL = 1) and automatic address matching is enabled (AUTOADDR in CFG = 1).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, the value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: CTRL
register.description: GPIO grouped interrupt control register

field.name: INT
field.description: Group interrupt status. This bit is cleared by writing a one to it. Writing zero has no effect.

field.name: COMB
field.description: Combine enabled inputs for group interrupt

enumeratedValue.name: OR_FUNCTIONALITY_A_
enumeratedValue.description: OR functionality: A grouped interrupt is generated when any one of the enabled inputs is active (based on its programmed polarity).

enumeratedValue.name: AND_FUNCTIONALITY_A
enumeratedValue.description: AND functionality: An interrupt is generated when all enabled bits are active (based on their programmed polarity).

field.name: TRIG
field.description: Group interrupt trigger

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

register.name: PORT_POL[%s]
register.description: GPIO grouped interrupt port 0 polarity register

field.name: POL0
field.description: Configure pin polarity of port m pins for group interrupt. Bit n corresponds to pin PIOm_n of port m. 0 = the pin is active LOW. If the level on this pin is LOW, the pin contributes to the group interrupt. 1 = the pin is active HIGH. If the level on this pin is HIGH, the pin contributes to the group interrupt.

register.name: MODE
register.description: CRC mode register

field.name: CRC_POLY
field.description: CRC polynom: 1X= CRC-32 polynomial 01= CRC-16 polynomial 00= CRC-CCITT polynomial

field.name: BIT_RVS_WR
field.description: Data bit order: 1= Bit order reverse for CRC_WR_DATA (per byte) 0= No bit order reverse for CRC_WR_DATA (per byte)

field.name: CMPL_WR
field.description: Data complement: 1= 1's complement for CRC_WR_DATA 0= No 1's complement for CRC_WR_DATA

field.name: BIT_RVS_SUM
field.description: CRC sum bit order: 1= Bit order reverse for CRC_SUM 0= No bit order reverse for CRC_SUM

field.name: CMPL_SUM
field.description: CRC sum complement: 1= 1's complement for CRC_SUM 0=No 1's complement for CRC_SUM

field.name: Reserved
field.description: Always 0 when read

register.name: SEED
register.description: CRC seed register

field.name: CRC_SEED
field.description: A write access to this register will load CRC seed value to CRC_SUM register with selected bit order and 1's complement pre-processes. A write access to this register will overrule the CRC calculation in progresses.

register.name: SUM
register.description: CRC checksum register

field.name: CRC_SUM
field.description: The most recent CRC sum can be read through this register with selected bit order and 1's complement post-processes.

register.name: WR_DATA
register.description: CRC data register

field.name: CRC_WR_DATA
field.description: Data written to this register will be taken to perform CRC calculation with selected bit order and 1's complement pre-process. Any write size 8, 16 or 32-bit are allowed and accept back-to-back transactions.

register.name: CTRL
register.description: DMA control.

field.name: ENABLE
field.description: DMA controller master enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The DMA controller is disabled. This clears any triggers that were asserted at the point when disabled, but does not prevent re-triggering when the DMA controller is re-enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The DMA controller is enabled.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: INTSTAT
register.description: Interrupt status.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: ACTIVEINT
field.description: Summarizes whether any enabled interrupts are pending.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_PENDING
enumeratedValue.description: Not pending. No enabled interrupts are pending.

enumeratedValue.name: PENDING
enumeratedValue.description: Pending. At least one enabled interrupt is pending.

field.name: ACTIVEERRINT
field.description: Summarizes whether any error interrupts are pending.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_PENDING
enumeratedValue.description: Not pending. No error interrupts are pending.

enumeratedValue.name: PENDING
enumeratedValue.description: Pending. At least one error interrupt is pending.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: SRAMBASE
register.description: SRAM address of the channel configuration table.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: OFFSET
field.description: Address of the beginning of the DMA descriptor table. The table must begin on a 1 kB boundary. Boundary needed for 18 channel DMA configuration: 512 bytes (bottom 9 bits = 0)

register.name: ENABLESET0
register.description: Channel Enable read and Set for all DMA channels.

field.name: ENA
field.description: Enable for DMA channels 15:0. Bit n enables or disables DMA channel n. 0 = disabled. 1 = enabled.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

register.name: ENABLECLR0
register.description: Channel Enable Clear for all DMA channels.

field.name: CLR
field.description: Writing ones to this register clears the corresponding bits in ENABLESET0. Bit n clears the channel enable bit n.

register.name: ACTIVE0
register.description: Channel Active status for all DMA channels.

field.name: ACT
field.description: Active flag for DMA channel n. Bit n corresponds to DMA channel n. 0 = not active. 1 = active.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

register.name: BUSY0
register.description: Channel Busy status for all DMA channels.

field.name: BSY
field.description: Busy flag for DMA channel n. Bit n corresponds to DMA channel n. 0 = not busy. 1 = busy.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

register.name: ERRINT0
register.description: Error Interrupt status for all DMA channels.

field.name: ERR
field.description: Error Interrupt flag for DMA channel n. Bit n corresponds to DMA channel n. 0 = error interrupt is not active. 1 = error interrupt is active.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

register.name: INTENSET0
register.description: Interrupt Enable read and Set for all DMA channels.

field.name: INTEN
field.description: Interrupt Enable read and set for DMA channel n. Bit n corresponds to DMA channel n. 0 = interrupt for DMA channel is disabled. 1 = interrupt for DMA channel is enabled.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

register.name: INTENCLR0
register.description: Interrupt Enable Clear for all DMA channels.

field.name: CLR
field.description: Writing ones to this register clears corresponding bits in the INTENSET0. Bit n corresponds to DMA channel n.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

register.name: INTA0
register.description: Interrupt A status for all DMA channels.

field.name: IA
field.description: Interrupt A status for DMA channel n. Bit n corresponds to DMA channel n. 0 = the DMA channel interrupt A is not active. 1 = the DMA channel interrupt A is active.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

register.name: INTB0
register.description: Interrupt B status for all DMA channels.

field.name: IB
field.description: Interrupt B status for DMA channel n. Bit n corresponds to DMA channel n. 0 = the DMA channel interrupt B is not active. 1 = the DMA channel interrupt B is active.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

register.name: SETVALID0
register.description: Set ValidPending control bits for all DMA channels.

field.name: SV
field.description: SETVALID control for DMA channel n. Bit n corresponds to DMA channel n. 0 = no effect. 1 = sets the VALIDPENDING control bit for DMA channel n.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

register.name: SETTRIG0
register.description: Set Trigger control bits for all DMA channels.

field.name: TRIG
field.description: Set Trigger control bit for DMA channel 0. Bit n corresponds to DMA channel n. 0 = no effect. 1 = sets the TRIG bit for DMA channel n.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

register.name: ABORT0
register.description: Channel Abort control for all DMA channels.

field.name: AORTCTRL
field.description: Abort control for DMA channel 0. Bit n corresponds to DMA channel n. 0 = no effect. 1 = aborts DMA operations on channel n.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

register.name: CFG%s
register.description: Configuration register for DMA channel 0.

field.name: PERIPHREQEN
field.description: Peripheral request Enable. If a DMA channel is used to perform a memory-to-memory move, any peripheral DMA request associated with that channel can be disabled to prevent any interaction between the peripheral and the DMA controller.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. Peripheral DMA requests are disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. Peripheral DMA requests are enabled.

field.name: HWTRIGEN
field.description: Hardware Triggering Enable for this channel.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. Hardware triggering is not used.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: TRIGPOL
field.description: Trigger Polarity. Selects the polarity of a hardware trigger for this channel.

enumeratedValue.name: ACTIVE_LOW__FALLING
enumeratedValue.description: Active low - falling edge. Hardware trigger is active low or falling edge triggered, based on TRIGTYPE.

enumeratedValue.name: ACTIVE_HIGH__RISING
enumeratedValue.description: Active high - rising edge. Hardware trigger is active high or rising edge triggered, based on TRIGTYPE.

field.name: TRIGTYPE
field.description: Trigger Type. Selects hardware trigger as edge triggered or level triggered.

enumeratedValue.name: EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Edge. Hardware trigger is edge triggered.

enumeratedValue.name: LEVEL
enumeratedValue.description: Level. Hardware trigger is level triggered. Note that when level triggering without burst (BURSTPOWER = 0) is selected, only hardware triggers should be used on that channel.

field.name: TRIGBURST
field.description: Trigger Burst. Selects whether hardware triggers cause a single or burst transfer.

enumeratedValue.name: SINGLE_TRANSFER
enumeratedValue.description: Single transfer. Hardware trigger causes a single transfer.

enumeratedValue.name: BURST_TRANSFER
enumeratedValue.description: Burst transfer. When the trigger for this channel is set to edge triggered, a hardware trigger causes a burst transfer, as defined by BURSTPOWER. When the trigger for this channel is set to level triggered, a hardware trigger causes transfers to continue as long as the trigger is asserted, unless the transfer is complete.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: BURSTPOWER
field.description: Burst Power is used in two ways. It always selects the address wrap size when SrcBurstWrap and/or DstBurstWrap is modes are selected (see descriptions elsewhere in this register). When the TRIGBURST field elsewhere in this register = 1, Burst Power selects how many transfers are performed for each DMA trigger. This can be used, for example, with peripherals that contain a FIFO that can initiate a DMA operation when the FIFO reaches a certain level. 0000: Burst size = 1 (20). 0001: Burst size = 2 (21). 0010: Burst size = 4 (22). ... 1010: Burst size = 1024 (210). This corresponds to the maximum supported transfer count. others: not supported.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: SRCBURSTWRAP
field.description: Source Burst Wrap. When enabled, the source data address for the DMA is wrapped, meaning that the source address range for each burst will be the same. As an example, this could be used to read several sequential registers from a peripheral for each DMA burst, reading the same registers again for each burst.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. Source burst wrapping is not enabled for this DMA channel.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. Source burst wrapping is enabled for this DMA channel.

field.name: DSTBURSTWRAP
field.description: Destination Burst Wrap. When enabled, the destination data address for the DMA is wrapped, meaning that the destination address range for each burst will be the same. As an example, this could be used to write several sequential registers to a peripheral for each DMA burst, writing the same registers again for each burst.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. Destination burst wrapping is not enabled for this DMA channel.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. Destination burst wrapping is enabled for this DMA channel.

field.name: CHPRIORITY
field.description: Priority of this channel when multiple DMA requests are pending. This description reflects a 2-bit priority field providing 4 priority levels. 0x0 = highest priority. 0x3 = lowest priority.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: CTLSTAT%s
register.description: Control and status register for DMA channel 0.

field.name: VALIDPENDING
field.description: Valid pending flag for this channel. This bit is set when a 1 is written to the corresponding bit in the related SETVALID register when CFGVALID = 1 for the same channel.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: TRIG
field.description: Trigger flag. Indicates that the trigger for this channel is currently set. This bit is cleared at the end of an entire transfer or upon reload when CLRTRIG = 1.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_TRIGGERED
enumeratedValue.description: Not triggered. The trigger for this DMA channel is not set. DMA operations will not be carried out.

enumeratedValue.name: TRIGGERED
enumeratedValue.description: Triggered. The trigger for this DMA channel is set. DMA operations will be carried out.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: XFERCFG%s
register.description: Transfer configuration register for DMA channel 0.

field.name: CFGVALID
field.description: Configuration Valid flag. This bit indicates whether the current channel descriptor is valid and can potentially be acted upon, if all other activation criteria are fulfilled.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_VALID
enumeratedValue.description: Not valid. The current channel descriptor is not considered valid.

enumeratedValue.name: VALID
enumeratedValue.description: Valid. The current channel descriptor is considered valid.

field.name: RELOAD
field.description: Indicates whether the channel's control structure will be reloaded when the current descriptor is exhausted. Reloading allows ping-pong and linked transfers.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. Do not reload the channels' control structure when the current descriptor is exhausted.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. Reload the channels' control structure when the current descriptor is exhausted.

field.name: SWTRIG
field.description: Software Trigger.

enumeratedValue.name: WHEN_WRITTEN_BY_SOFT
enumeratedValue.description: When written by software, the trigger for this channel is not set. A new trigger, as defined by the HWTRIGEN, TRIGPOL, and TRIGTYPE will be needed to start the channel.

enumeratedValue.name: WHEN_WRITTEN_BY_SOFT
enumeratedValue.description: When written by software, the trigger for this channel is set immediately. This feature should not be used with level triggering when TRIGBURST = 0.

field.name: CLRTRIG
field.description: Clear Trigger.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_CLEARED
enumeratedValue.description: Not cleared. The trigger is not cleared when this descriptor is exhausted. If there is a reload, the next descriptor will be started.

enumeratedValue.name: CLEARED
enumeratedValue.description: Cleared. The trigger is cleared when this descriptor is exhausted.

field.name: SETINTA
field.description: Set Interrupt flag A for this channel. There is no hardware distinction between interrupt A and B. They can be used by software to assist with more complex descriptor usage. By convention, interrupt A may be used when only one interrupt flag is needed.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Set. The INTA flag for this channel will be set when the current descriptor is exhausted.

field.name: SETINTB
field.description: Set Interrupt flag B for this channel. There is no hardware distinction between interrupt A and B. They can be used by software to assist with more complex descriptor usage. By convention, interrupt A may be used when only one interrupt flag is needed.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Set. The INTB flag for this channel will be set when the current descriptor is exhausted.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: WIDTH
field.description: Transfer width used for this DMA channel.

enumeratedValue.name: 8_BIT_TRANSFERS
enumeratedValue.description: 8-bit transfers are performed (8-bit source reads and destination writes).

enumeratedValue.name: 16_BIT_TRANSFERS
enumeratedValue.description: 16-bit transfers are performed (16-bit source reads and destination writes).

enumeratedValue.name: 32_BIT_TRANSFERS
enumeratedValue.description: 32-bit transfers are performed (32-bit source reads and destination writes).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

field.name: SRCINC
field.description: Determines whether the source address is incremented for each DMA transfer.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_INCREMENT
enumeratedValue.description: No increment. The source address is not incremented for each transfer. This is the usual case when the source is a peripheral device.

enumeratedValue.name: 1_X_WIDTH
enumeratedValue.description: 1 x width. The source address is incremented by the amount specified by Width for each transfer. This is the usual case when the source is memory.

enumeratedValue.name: 2_X_WIDTH
enumeratedValue.description: 2 x width. The source address is incremented by 2 times the amount specified by Width for each transfer.

enumeratedValue.name: 4_X_WIDTH
enumeratedValue.description: 4 x width. The source address is incremented by 4 times the amount specified by Width for each transfer.

field.name: DSTINC
field.description: Determines whether the destination address is incremented for each DMA transfer.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_INCREMENT
enumeratedValue.description: No increment. The destination address is not incremented for each transfer. This is the usual case when the destination is a peripheral device.

enumeratedValue.name: 1_X_WIDTH
enumeratedValue.description: 1 x width. The destination address is incremented by the amount specified by Width for each transfer. This is the usual case when the destination is memory.

enumeratedValue.name: 2_X_WIDTH
enumeratedValue.description: 2 x width. The destination address is incremented by 2 times the amount specified by Width for each transfer.

enumeratedValue.name: 4_X_WIDTH
enumeratedValue.description: 4 x width. The destination address is incremented by 4 times the amount specified by Width for each transfer.

field.name: XFERCOUNT
field.description: Total number of transfers to be performed, minus 1 encoded. The number of bytes transferred is: (XFERCOUNT + 1) x data width (as defined by the WIDTH field). The DMA controller uses this bit field during transfer to count down. Hence, it cannot be used by software to read back the size of the transfer, for instance, in an interrupt handler. 0x0 = a total of 1 transfer will be performed. 0x1 = a total of 2 transfers will be performed. ... 0x3FF = a total of 1,024 transfers will be performed.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

register.name: CONFIG
register.description: SCT configuration register

field.name: UNIFY
field.description: SCT operation

enumeratedValue.name: THE_SCT_OPERATES_AS
enumeratedValue.description: The SCT operates as two 16-bit counters named L and H.

enumeratedValue.name: THE_SCT_OPERATES_AS
enumeratedValue.description: The SCT operates as a unified 32-bit counter.

field.name: CLKMODE
field.description: SCT clock mode

enumeratedValue.name: THE_BUS_CLOCK_CLOCKS
enumeratedValue.description: The bus clock clocks the SCT and prescalers.

enumeratedValue.name: THE_SCT_CLOCK_IS_THE
enumeratedValue.description: The SCT clock is the bus clock, but the prescalers are enabled to count only when sampling of the input selected by the CKSEL field finds the selected edge. The minimum pulse width on the clock input is 1 bus clock period. This mode is the high-performance sampled-clock mode.

enumeratedValue.name: THE_INPUT_SELECTED_B
enumeratedValue.description: The input selected by CKSEL clocks the SCT and prescalers. The input is synchronized to the bus clock and possibly inverted. The minimum pulse width on the clock input is 1 bus clock period. This mode is the low-power sampled-clock mode.

enumeratedValue.name: PRESCALED_SCT_INPUT
enumeratedValue.description: Prescaled SCT input. The SCT and prescalers are clocked by the input edge selected by the CKSEL field. In this mode, most of the SCT is clocked by the (selected polarity of the) input. The outputs are switched synchronously to the input clock. The input clock rate must be at least half the system clock rate and can the same or faster than the system clock.

field.name: CKSEL
field.description: SCT clock select

field.name: NORELAOD_L
field.description: A 1 in this bit prevents the lower match registers from being reloaded from their respective reload registers. Software can write to set or clear this bit at any time. This bit applies to both the higher and lower registers when the UNIFY bit is set.

field.name: NORELOAD_H
field.description: A 1 in this bit prevents the higher match registers from being reloaded from their respective reload registers. Software can write to set or clear this bit at any time. This bit is not used when the UNIFY bit is set.

field.name: INSYNC
field.description: Synchronization for input N (bit 9 = input 0, bit 10 = input 1,..., bit 12 = input 3); all other bits are reserved. A 1 in one of these bits subjects the corresponding input to synchronization to the SCT clock, before it is used to create an event. If an input is synchronous to the SCT clock, keep its bit 0 for faster response. When the CKMODE field is 1x, the bit in this field, corresponding to the input selected by the CKSEL field, is not used.

field.name: AUTOLIMIT_L
field.description: A one in this bit causes a match on match register 0 to be treated as a de-facto LIMIT condition without the need to define an associated event. As with any LIMIT event, this automatic limit causes the counter to be cleared to zero in uni-directional mode or to change the direction of count in bi-directional mode. Software can write to set or clear this bit at any time. This bit applies to both the higher and lower registers when the UNIFY bit is set.

field.name: AUTOLIMIT_H
field.description: A one in this bit will cause a match on match register 0 to be treated as a de-facto LIMIT condition without the need to define an associated event. As with any LIMIT event, this automatic limit causes the counter to be cleared to zero in uni-directional mode or to change the direction of count in bi-directional mode. Software can write to set or clear this bit at any time. This bit is not used when the UNIFY bit is set.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

register.name: CTRL
register.description: SCT control register

field.name: DOWN_L
field.description: This bit is 1 when the L or unified counter is counting down. Hardware sets this bit when the counter limit is reached and BIDIR is 1. Hardware clears this bit when the counter is counting down and a limit condition occurs or when the counter reaches 0.

field.name: STOP_L
field.description: When this bit is 1 and HALT is 0, the L or unified counter does not run, but I/O events related to the counter can occur. If such an event matches the mask in the Start register, this bit is cleared and counting resumes.

field.name: HALT_L
field.description: When this bit is 1, the L or unified counter does not run and no events can occur. A reset sets this bit. When the HALT_L bit is one, the STOP_L bit is cleared. If you want to remove the halt condition and keep the SCT in the stop condition (not running), then you can change the halt and stop condition with one single write to this register. Once set, only software can clear this bit to restore counter operation.

field.name: CLRCTR_L
field.description: Writing a 1 to this bit clears the L or unified counter. This bit always reads as 0.

field.name: BIDIR_L
field.description: L or unified counter direction select

enumeratedValue.name: THE_COUNTER_COUNTS_U
enumeratedValue.description: The counter counts up to its limit condition, then is cleared to zero.

enumeratedValue.name: THE_COUNTER_COUNTS_U
enumeratedValue.description: The counter counts up to its limit, then counts down to a limit condition or to 0.

field.name: PRE_L
field.description: Specifies the factor by which the SCT clock is prescaled to produce the L or unified counter clock. The counter clock is clocked at the rate of the SCT clock divided by PRE_L+1. Clear the counter (by writing a 1 to the CLRCTR bit) whenever changing the PRE value.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: DOWN_H
field.description: This bit is 1 when the H counter is counting down. Hardware sets this bit when the counter limit is reached and BIDIR is 1. Hardware clears this bit when the counter is counting down and a limit condition occurs or when the counter reaches 0.

field.name: STOP_H
field.description: When this bit is 1 and HALT is 0, the H counter does not, run but I/O events related to the counter can occur. If such an event matches the mask in the Start register, this bit is cleared and counting resumes.

field.name: HALT_H
field.description: When this bit is 1, the H counter does not run and no events can occur. A reset sets this bit. When the HALT_H bit is one, the STOP_H bit is cleared. If you want to remove the halt condition and keep the SCT in the stop condition (not running), then you can change the halt and stop condition with one single write to this register. Once set, this bit can only be cleared by software to restore counter operation.

field.name: CLRCTR_H
field.description: Writing a 1 to this bit clears the H counter. This bit always reads as 0.

field.name: BIDIR_H
field.description: Direction select

enumeratedValue.name: THE_H_COUNTER_COUNTS
enumeratedValue.description: The H counter counts up to its limit condition, then is cleared to zero.

enumeratedValue.name: THE_H_COUNTER_COUNTS
enumeratedValue.description: The H counter counts up to its limit, then counts down to a limit condition or to 0.

field.name: PRE_H
field.description: Specifies the factor by which the SCT clock is prescaled to produce the H counter clock. The counter clock is clocked at the rate of the SCT clock divided by PRELH+1. Clear the counter (by writing a 1 to the CLRCTR bit) whenever changing the PRE value.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

register.name: LIMIT
register.description: SCT limit register

field.name: LIMMSK_L
field.description: If bit n is one, event n is used as a counter limit for the L or unified counter (event 0 = bit 0, event 1 = bit 1, event 5 = bit 5).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: LIMMSK_H
field.description: If bit n is one, event n is used as a counter limit for the H counter (event 0 = bit 16, event 1 = bit 17, event 5 = bit 21).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

register.name: HALT
register.description: SCT halt condition register

field.name: HALTMSK_L
field.description: If bit n is one, event n sets the HALT_L bit in the CTRL register (event 0 = bit 0, event 1 = bit 1, event 5 = bit 5).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: HALTMSK_H
field.description: If bit n is one, event n sets the HALT_H bit in the CTRL register (event 0 = bit 16, event 1 = bit 17, event 5 = bit 21).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

register.name: STOP
register.description: SCT stop condition register

field.name: STOPMSK_L
field.description: If bit n is one, event n sets the STOP_L bit in the CTRL register (event 0 = bit 0, event 1 = bit 1, event 5 = bit 5).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: STOPMSK_H
field.description: If bit n is one, event n sets the STOP_H bit in the CTRL register (event 0 = bit 16, event 1 = bit 17, event 5 = bit 21).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

register.name: START
register.description: SCT start condition register

field.name: STARTMSK_L
field.description: If bit n is one, event n clears the STOP_L bit in the CTRL register (event 0 = bit 0, event 1 = bit 1, event 5 = bit 5).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: STARTMSK_H
field.description: If bit n is one, event n clears the STOP_H bit in the CTRL register (event 0 = bit 16, event 1 = bit 17, event 5 = bit 21).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

register.name: COUNT
register.description: SCT counter register

field.name: CTR_L
field.description: When UNIFY = 0, read or write the 16-bit L counter value. When UNIFY = 1, read or write the lower 16 bits of the 32-bit unified counter.

field.name: CTR_H
field.description: When UNIFY = 0, read or write the 16-bit H counter value. When UNIFY = 1, read or write the upper 16 bits of the 32-bit unified counter.

register.name: STATE
register.description: SCT state register

field.name: STATE_L
field.description: State variable.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: STATE_H
field.description: State variable.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

register.name: INPUT
register.description: SCT input register

field.name: AIN0
field.description: Real-time status of input 0.

field.name: AIN1
field.description: Real-time status of input 1.

field.name: AIN2
field.description: Real-time status of input 2.

field.name: AIN3
field.description: Real-time status of input 3.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: SIN0
field.description: Input 0 state synchronized to the SCT clock.

field.name: SIN1
field.description: Input 1 state synchronized to the SCT clock.

field.name: SIN2
field.description: Input 2 state synchronized to the SCT clock.

field.name: SIN3
field.description: Input 3 state synchronized to the SCT clock.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

register.name: REGMODE
register.description: SCT match/capture registers mode register

field.name: REGMOD_L
field.description: Each bit controls one pair of match/capture registers (register 0 = bit 0, register 1 = bit 1,..., register 4 = bit 4). 0 = registers operate as match registers. 1 = registers operate as capture registers.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: REGMOD_H
field.description: Each bit controls one pair of match/capture registers (register 0 = bit 16, register 1 = bit 17,..., register 4 = bit 20). 0 = registers operate as match registers. 1 = registers operate as capture registers.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

register.name: OUTPUT
register.description: SCT output register

field.name: OUT
field.description: Writing a 1 to bit n makes the corresponding output HIGH. 0 makes the corresponding output LOW (output 0 = bit 0, output 1 = bit 1,..., output 3 = bit 3).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

register.name: OUTPUTDIRCTRL
register.description: SCT output counter direction control register

field.name: SETCLR0
field.description: Set/clear operation on output 0. Value 0x3 is reserved. Do not program this value.

enumeratedValue.name: SET_AND_CLEAR_DO_NOT
enumeratedValue.description: Set and clear do not depend on any counter.

enumeratedValue.name: SET_AND_CLEAR_ARE_RE
enumeratedValue.description: Set and clear are reversed when counter L or the unified counter is counting down.

enumeratedValue.name: SET_AND_CLEAR_ARE_RE
enumeratedValue.description: Set and clear are reversed when counter H is counting down. Do not use if UNIFY = 1.

field.name: SETCLR1
field.description: Set/clear operation on output 1. Value 0x3 is reserved. Do not program this value.

enumeratedValue.name: SET_AND_CLEAR_DO_NOT
enumeratedValue.description: Set and clear do not depend on any counter.

enumeratedValue.name: SET_AND_CLEAR_ARE_RE
enumeratedValue.description: Set and clear are reversed when counter L or the unified counter is counting down.

enumeratedValue.name: SET_AND_CLEAR_ARE_RE
enumeratedValue.description: Set and clear are reversed when counter H is counting down. Do not use if UNIFY = 1.

field.name: SETCLR2
field.description: Set/clear operation on output 2. Value 0x3 is reserved. Do not program this value.

enumeratedValue.name: SET_AND_CLEAR_DO_NOT
enumeratedValue.description: Set and clear do not depend on any counter.

enumeratedValue.name: SET_AND_CLEAR_ARE_RE
enumeratedValue.description: Set and clear are reversed when counter L or the unified counter is counting down.

enumeratedValue.name: SET_AND_CLEAR_ARE_RE
enumeratedValue.description: Set and clear are reversed when counter H is counting down. Do not use if UNIFY = 1.

field.name: SETCLR3
field.description: Set/clear operation on output 3. Value 0x3 is reserved. Do not program this value.

enumeratedValue.name: SET_AND_CLEAR_DO_NOT
enumeratedValue.description: Set and clear do not depend on any counter.

enumeratedValue.name: SET_AND_CLEAR_ARE_RE
enumeratedValue.description: Set and clear are reversed when counter L or the unified counter is counting down.

enumeratedValue.name: SET_AND_CLEAR_ARE_RE
enumeratedValue.description: Set and clear are reversed when counter H is counting down. Do not use if UNIFY = 1.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

register.name: RES
register.description: SCT conflict resolution register

field.name: O0RES
field.description: Effect of simultaneous set and clear on output 0.

enumeratedValue.name: SET_OUTPUT_OR_CLEAR
enumeratedValue.description: Set output (or clear based on the SETCLR0 field).

enumeratedValue.name: CLEAR_OUTPUT_OR_SET
enumeratedValue.description: Clear output (or set based on the SETCLR0 field).

field.name: O1RES
field.description: Effect of simultaneous set and clear on output 1.

enumeratedValue.name: SET_OUTPUT_OR_CLEAR
enumeratedValue.description: Set output (or clear based on the SETCLR1 field).

enumeratedValue.name: CLEAR_OUTPUT_OR_SET
enumeratedValue.description: Clear output (or set based on the SETCLR1 field).

field.name: O2RES
field.description: Effect of simultaneous set and clear on output 2.

enumeratedValue.name: SET_OUTPUT_OR_CLEAR
enumeratedValue.description: Set output (or clear based on the SETCLR2 field).

enumeratedValue.name: CLEAR_OUTPUT_N_OR_S
enumeratedValue.description: Clear output n (or set based on the SETCLR2 field).

field.name: O3RES
field.description: Effect of simultaneous set and clear on output 3.

enumeratedValue.name: SET_OUTPUT_OR_CLEAR
enumeratedValue.description: Set output (or clear based on the SETCLR3 field).

enumeratedValue.name: CLEAR_OUTPUT_OR_SET
enumeratedValue.description: Clear output (or set based on the SETCLR3 field).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

register.name: DMAREQ0
register.description: SCT DMA request 0 register

field.name: DEV_0
field.description: If bit n is one, event n sets DMA request 0 (event 0 = bit 0, event 1 = bit 1,..., event 5 = bit 5).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: DRL0
field.description: A 1 in this bit makes the SCT set DMA request 0 when it loads the Match_L/Unified registers from the Reload_L/Unified registers.

field.name: DRQ0
field.description: This read-only bit indicates the state of DMA Request 0

register.name: DMAREQ1
register.description: SCT DMA request 1 register

field.name: DEV_1
field.description: If bit n is one, event n sets DMA request 1 (event 0 = bit 0, event 1 = bit 1,..., event 5 = bit 5).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: DRL1
field.description: A 1 in this bit makes the SCT set DMA request 1 when it loads the Match L/Unified registers from the Reload L/Unified registers.

field.name: DRQ1
field.description: This read-only bit indicates the state of DMA Request 1.

register.name: EVEN
register.description: SCT event enable register

field.name: IEN
field.description: The SCT requests interrupt when bit n of this register and the event flag register are both one (event 0 = bit 0, event 1 = bit 1,..., event 5 = bit 5).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

register.name: EVFLAG
register.description: SCT event flag register

field.name: FLAG
field.description: Bit n is one if event n has occurred since reset or a 1 was last written to this bit (event 0 = bit 0, event 1 = bit 1,..., event 5 = bit 5).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

register.name: CONEN
register.description: SCT conflict enable register

field.name: NCEN
field.description: The SCT requests interrupt when bit n of this register and the SCT conflict flag register are both one (output 0 = bit 0, output 1 = bit 1,..., output 3 = bit 3).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

register.name: CONFLAG
register.description: SCT conflict flag register

field.name: NCFLAG
field.description: Bit n is one if a no-change conflict event occurred on output n since reset or a 1 was last written to this bit (output 0 = bit 0, output 1 = bit 1,..., output 3 = bit 3).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: BUSERRL
field.description: The most recent bus error from this SCT involved writing CTR L/Unified, STATE L/Unified, MATCH L/Unified, or the Output register when the L/U counter was not halted. A word write to certain L and H registers can be half successful and half unsuccessful.

field.name: BUSERRH
field.description: The most recent bus error from this SCT involved writing CTR H, STATE H, MATCH H, or the Output register when the H counter was not halted.

register.name: MATCH%s
register.description: SCT match value register of match channels 0 to 4; REGMOD0 to REGMODE4 = 0

field.name: MATCHn_L
field.description: When UNIFY = 0, read or write the 16-bit value to be compared to the L counter. When UNIFY = 1, read or write the lower 16 bits of the 32-bit value to be compared to the unified counter.

field.name: MATCHn_H
field.description: When UNIFY = 0, read or write the 16-bit value to be compared to the H counter. When UNIFY = 1, read or write the upper 16 bits of the 32-bit value to be compared to the unified counter.

register.name: CAP%s
register.description: SCT capture register of capture channel 0 to 4; REGMOD0 to REGMODE4 = 1

field.name: CAPn_L
field.description: When UNIFY = 0, read the 16-bit counter value at which this register was last captured. When UNIFY = 1, read the lower 16 bits of the 32-bit value at which this register was last captured.

field.name: CAPn_H
field.description: When UNIFY = 0, read the 16-bit counter value at which this register was last captured. When UNIFY = 1, read the upper 16 bits of the 32-bit value at which this register was last captured.

register.name: MATCHREL%s
register.description: SCT match reload value register 0 to 4; REGMOD0 = 0 to REGMODE4 = 0

field.name: RELOADn_L
field.description: When UNIFY = 0, read or write the 16-bit value to be loaded into the SCTMATCHn_L register. When UNIFY = 1, read or write the lower 16 bits of the 32-bit value to be loaded into the MATCHn register.

field.name: RELOADn_H
field.description: When UNIFY = 0, read or write the 16-bit to be loaded into the MATCHn_H register. When UNIFY = 1, read or write the upper 16 bits of the 32-bit value to be loaded into the MATCHn register.

register.name: CAPCTRL%s
register.description: SCT capture control register 0 to 4; REGMOD0 = 1 to REGMODE4 = 1

field.name: CAPCONn_L
field.description: If bit m is one, event m causes the CAPn_L (UNIFY = 0) or the CAPn (UNIFY = 1) register to be loaded (event 0 = bit 0, event 1 = bit 1,..., event 5 = bit 5).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: CAPCONn_H
field.description: If bit m is one, event m causes the CAPn_H (UNIFY = 0) register to be loaded (event 0 = bit 16, event 1 = bit 17,..., event 5 = bit 21).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

register.name: EV%s_STATE
register.description: SCT event state register 0

field.name: STATEMSKn
field.description: If bit m is one, event n (n= 0 to 5) happens in state m of the counter selected by the HEVENT bit (m = state number; state 0 = bit 0, state 1= bit 1,..., state 7 = bit 7).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

register.name: EV%s_CTRL
register.description: SCT event control register 0

field.name: MATCHSEL
field.description: Selects the Match register associated with this event (if any). A match can occur only when the counter selected by the HEVENT bit is running.

field.name: HEVENT
field.description: Select L/H counter. Do not set this bit if UNIFY = 1.

enumeratedValue.name: SELECTS_THE_L_STATE
enumeratedValue.description: Selects the L state and the L match register selected by MATCHSEL.

enumeratedValue.name: SELECTS_THE_H_STATE
enumeratedValue.description: Selects the H state and the H match register selected by MATCHSEL.

field.name: OUTSEL
field.description: Input/output select

enumeratedValue.name: SELECTS_THE_INPUTS_E
enumeratedValue.description: Selects the inputs elected by IOSEL.

enumeratedValue.name: SELECTS_THE_OUTPUTS
enumeratedValue.description: Selects the outputs selected by IOSEL.

field.name: IOSEL
field.description: Selects the input or output signal number (0 to 3) associated with this event (if any). Do not select an input in this register, if CKMODE is 1x. In this case the clock input is an implicit ingredient of every event.

field.name: IOCOND
field.description: Selects the I/O condition for event n. (The detection of edges on outputs lag the conditions that switch the outputs by one SCT clock). In order to guarantee proper edge/state detection, an input must have a minimum pulse width of at least one SCT clock period .

field.name: COMBMODE
field.description: Selects how the specified match and I/O condition are used and combined.

enumeratedValue.name: OR
enumeratedValue.description: OR. The event occurs when either the specified match or I/O condition occurs.

enumeratedValue.name: MATCH
enumeratedValue.description: MATCH. Uses the specified match only.

enumeratedValue.name: IO
enumeratedValue.description: IO. Uses the specified I/O condition only.

enumeratedValue.name: AND
enumeratedValue.description: AND. The event occurs when the specified match and I/O condition occur simultaneously.

field.name: STATELD
field.description: This bit controls how the STATEV value modifies the state selected by HEVENT when this event is the highest-numbered event occurring for that state.

enumeratedValue.name: STATEV_VALUE_IS_ADDE
enumeratedValue.description: STATEV value is added into STATE (the carry-out is ignored).

enumeratedValue.name: STATEV_VALUE_IS_LOAD
enumeratedValue.description: STATEV value is loaded into STATE.

field.name: STATEV
field.description: This value is loaded into or added to the state selected by HEVENT, depending on STATELD, when this event is the highest-numbered event occurring for that state. If STATELD and STATEV are both zero, there is no change to the STATE value.

field.name: MATCHMEM
field.description: If this bit is one and the COMBMODE field specifies a match component to the triggering of this event, then a match is considered to be active whenever the counter value is GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO the value specified in the match register when counting up, LESS THEN OR EQUAL TO the match value when counting down. If this bit is zero, a match is only be active during the cycle when the counter is equal to the match value.

field.name: DIRECTION
field.description: Direction qualifier for event generation. This field only applies when the counters are operating in BIDIR mode. If BIDIR = 0, the SCT ignores this field. Value 0x3 is reserved.

enumeratedValue.name: DIRECTION_INDEPENDEN
enumeratedValue.description: Direction independent. This event is triggered regardless of the count direction.

enumeratedValue.name: COUNTING_UP
enumeratedValue.description: Counting up. This event is triggered only during up-counting when BIDIR = 1.

enumeratedValue.name: COUNTING_DOWN
enumeratedValue.description: Counting down. This event is triggered only during down-counting when BIDIR = 1.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

register.name: OUT%s_SET
register.description: SCT output 0 set register

field.name: SET
field.description: A 1 in bit m selects event m to set output n (or clear it if SETCLRn = 0x1 or 0x2) event 0 = bit 0, event 1 = bit 1,..., event 5 = bit 5.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

register.name: OUT%s_CLR
register.description: SCT output 0 clear register

field.name: CLR
field.description: A 1 in bit m selects event m to clear output n (or set it if SETCLRn = 0x1 or 0x2) event 0 = bit 0, event 1 = bit 1,..., event 5 = bit 5.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

register.name: B[%s]
register.description: Byte pin registers

field.name: PBYTE
field.description: Read: state of the pin PIOm_n, regardless of direction, masking, or alternate function, except that pins configured as analog I/O always read as 0. One register for each port pin: m = port 0 to 2; n = pin 0 to 31 for port 0 and 1 and pin 0 to 11 for port 2. Write: loads the pin's output bit.

register.name: W[%s]
register.description: Word pin registers

field.name: PWORD
field.description: Read 0: pin PIOm_n is LOW. Write 0: clear output bit. Read 0xFFFF FFFF: pin PIOm_n is HIGH. Write any value 0x0000 0001 to 0xFFFF FFFF: set output bit. Only 0 or 0xFFFF FFFF can be read. Writing any value other than 0 will set the output bit. One register for each port pin: m = port 0 to 2; n = pin 0 to 31 for port 0 and 1 and pin 0 to 11 for port2.

register.name: DIR[%s]
register.description: Port Direction registers

field.name: DIRP0
field.description: Selects pin direction for pin PIOm_n (bit 0 = PIOm_0, bit 1 = PIOm_1, ..., bit 31 = PIOm_31). m = port 0 to 2; n = pin 0 to 31 for port 0 and 1 and pin 0 to 11 for port2. 0 = input. 1 = output.

field.name: DIRP1
field.description: Selects pin direction for pin PIOm_n (bit 0 = PIOm_0, bit 1 = PIOm_1, ..., bit 31 = PIOm_31). m = port 0 to 2; n = pin 0 to 31 for port 0 and 1 and pin 0 to 11 for port2. 0 = input. 1 = output.

register.name: MASK[%s]
register.description: Port Mask register

field.name: MASKP0
field.description: Controls which bits corresponding to PIOm_n are active in the MPORT register (bit 0 = PIOm_0, bit 1 = PIOm_1, ..., bit 31 = PIOm_31). m = port 0 to 2; n = pin 0 to 31 for port 0 and 1 and pin 0 to 11 for port2. 0 = Read MPORT: pin state; write MPORT: load output bit. 1 = Read MPORT: 0; write MPORT: output bit not affected.

field.name: MASKP1
field.description: Controls which bits corresponding to PIOm_n are active in the MPORT register (bit 0 = PIOm_0, bit 1 = PIOm_1, ..., bit 31 = PIOm_31). m = port 0 to 2; n = pin 0 to 31 for port 0 and 1 and pin 0 to 11 for port2. 0 = Read MPORT: pin state; write MPORT: load output bit. 1 = Read MPORT: 0; write MPORT: output bit not affected.

register.name: MPIN[%s]
register.description: Masked port register

field.name: MPORTP0
field.description: Masked port register (bit 0 = PIOm_0, bit 1 =PIOm_1, ..., bit 31 = PIOm_31). m = port 0 to 2; n = pin 0 to 31 for port 0 and 1 and pin 0 to 11 for port2. 0 = Read: pin is LOW and/or the corresponding bit in the MASK register is 1; write: clear output bit if the corresponding bit in the MASK register is 0. 1 = Read: pin is HIGH and the corresponding bit in the MASK register is 0; write: set output bit if the corresponding bit in the MASK register is 0.

register.name: ISEL

field.name: PMODE0
field.description: Selects the interrupt mode for each pin interrupt. Bit n configures the pin interrupt selected in PINTSELn. 0 = Edge sensitive 1 = Level sensitive

register.name: IENR

register.name: IENF
register.description: Pin interrupt active level or falling edge interrupt enable register

field.name: ENAF0
field.description: Enables the falling edge or configures the active level interrupt for each pin interrupt. Bit n configures the pin interrupt selected in PINTSELn. 0 = Disable falling edge interrupt or set active interrupt level LOW. 1 = Enable falling edge interrupt enabled or set active interrupt level HIGH.

field.name: ENAF1
field.description: Enables the falling edge or configures the active level interrupt for each pin interrupt. Bit n configures the pin interrupt selected in PINTSELn. 0 = Disable falling edge interrupt or set active interrupt level LOW. 1 = Enable falling edge interrupt enabled or set active interrupt level HIGH.

register.name: SIENF

field.description: Ones written to this address set bits in the IENF, thus enabling interrupts. Bit n sets bit n in the IENF register. 0 = No operation. 1 = Select HIGH-active interrupt or enable falling edge interrupt.

register.name: CIENF

field.description: Ones written to this address clears bits in the IENF, thus disabling interrupts. Bit n clears bit n in the IENF register. 0 = No operation. 1 = LOW-active interrupt selected or falling edge interrupt disabled.

register.name: RISE
register.description: Pin interrupt rising edge register

field.name: RDET0
field.description: Rising edge detect. Bit n detects the rising edge of the pin selected in PINTSELn. Read 0: No rising edge has been detected on this pin since Reset or the last time a one was written to this bit. Write 0: no operation. Read 1: a rising edge has been detected since Reset or the last time a one was written to this bit. Write 1: clear rising edge detection for this pin.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

register.name: IST
register.description: Pin interrupt status register

field.name: PSTAT0
field.description: Pin interrupt status. Bit n returns the status, clears the edge interrupt, or inverts the active level of the pin selected in PINTSELn. Read 0: interrupt is not being requested for this interrupt pin. Write 0: no operation. Read 1: interrupt is being requested for this interrupt pin. Write 1 (edge-sensitive): clear rising- and falling-edge detection for this pin. Write 1 (level-sensitive): switch the active level for this pin (in the IENF register).

field.name: PSTAT1
field.description: Pin interrupt status. Bit n returns the status, clears the edge interrupt, or inverts the active level of the pin selected in PINTSELn. Write 1 (edge-sensitive): clear rising- and falling-edge detection for this pin. Write 1 (level-sensitive): switch the active level for this pin (in the IENF register).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

register.name: PMCTRL
register.description: Pattern match interrupt control register

field.name: SEL_PMATCH
field.description: Specifies whether the 8 pin interrupts are controlled by the pin interrupt function or by the pattern match function.

enumeratedValue.name: PIN_INTERRUPT_INTER
enumeratedValue.description: Pin interrupt. Interrupts are driven in response to the standard pin interrupt function

enumeratedValue.name: PATTERN_MATCH_INTER
enumeratedValue.description: Pattern match. Interrupts are driven in response to pattern matches.

field.name: ENA_RXEV
field.description: Enables the RXEV output to the ARM cpu and/or to a GPIO output when the specified boolean expression evaluates to true.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED_RXEV_OUTPU
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. RXEV output to the cpu is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED_RXEV_OUTPUT
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. RXEV output to the cpu is enabled.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Do not write 1s to unused bits.

field.name: PMAT
field.description: This field displays the current state of pattern matches. A 1 in any bit of this field indicates that the corresponding product term is matched by the current state of the appropriate inputs.

register.name: PMCFG
register.description: Pattern match interrupt bit slice configuration register

field.name: PROD_ENDPTS
field.description: A 1 in any bit of this field causes the corresponding bit slice to be the final component of a product term in the boolean expression. This has two effects: 1. The interrupt request associated with this bit-slice will be asserted whenever a match to that product term is detected. 2. The next bit slice will start a new, independent product term in the boolean expression (i.e. an OR will be inserted in the boolean expression following the element controlled by this bit slice).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Bit slice 7 is automatically considered a product end point.

field.name: CFG0
field.description: Specifies the match contribution condition for bit slice 0.

enumeratedValue.name: CONSTANT_HIGH_THIS_
enumeratedValue.description: Constant HIGH. This bit slice always contributes to a product term match.

enumeratedValue.name: STICKY_RISING_EDGEMA
enumeratedValue.description: Sticky rising edgeMatch occurs if a rising edge on the specified input has occurred since the last time the edge detection for this bit slice was cleared. This bit is only cleared when the PMCFG or the PMSRC registers are written to.

enumeratedValue.name: STICKY_FALLING_EDGE_
enumeratedValue.description: Sticky falling edge. Match occurs if a falling edge on the specified input has occurred since the last time the edge detection for this bit slice was cleared. This bit is only cleared when the PMCFG or the PMSRC registers are written to.

enumeratedValue.name: STICKY_RISING_OR_FAL
enumeratedValue.description: Sticky rising or falling edge. Match occurs if either a rising or falling edge on the specified input has occurred since the last time the edge detection for this bit slice was cleared. This bit is only cleared when the PMCFG or the PMSRC registers are written to.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH_LEVEL_MATCH_F
enumeratedValue.description: High level. Match (for this bit slice) occurs when there is a high level on the input specified for this bit slice in the PMSRC register.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW_LEVEL_MATCH_OCC
enumeratedValue.description: Low level. Match occurs when there is a low level on the specified input.

enumeratedValue.name: CONSTANT_0_THIS_BIT
enumeratedValue.description: Constant 0. This bit slice never contributes to a match (should be used to disable any unused bit slices).

enumeratedValue.name: EVENT_NON_STICKY_RI
enumeratedValue.description: Event. Non-sticky rising or falling edge. Match occurs on an event - i.e. when either a rising or falling edge is first detected on the specified input (this is a non-sticky version of option 3) . This bit is cleared after one clock cycle.
